author: XXXTentacIes
body:
As a true autist raised and living in Miami, I can attest to this. 

This was my first week trading options, msft, nvda, amd, ally, good calls. And now the market plummets so I fucked up my bank acc, -700 rn. 

I went to a different bank 30 min before market close to open another bank acc so I can get instant deposit back and actually get a green portfolio. 

The bank teller who helped me was a big booty Latina and she was very nice and flirty. I think that helped because I’m not actually able to open another bank acc because of past closed accounts. So yes. 

Every autistman, and every wiseman, needs a big booty Latina.

author: wastedmylife1
body: I’m so god damn angry about selling my nvda calls. I actually had the right move for once, all I had to do was wait. It’s like a perfect storm - baba falling on earnings scared me off from nvda earnings so I sold, then nvda goes up. It’s as if the universe is plotting against me. Fuck. I know I’m going to be made fun of for expressing honest frustration but really, not only can I not get a win but the market has to tease me in the process. God damn it.

author: freehouse_throwaway
body:
once again i fucked one of my accounts up with ROKU

last time was in mid-2019 with credit call spread for ER that went to max loss (8k?)

today was buying weeklies *after* ER fade started and continued. which so far is unrealized loss of like 3.2k (2/21 145c to 150c and 2/28 150c)

instead of taking the L, I kept scooping up the dip like a true retard. had 3 instances i can get out for near break-even or to a minimal 20% loss but instead kept holding even though trend was clear that it'll reverse and go red.

wiped all my NVDA calendar call spread gains (and FD scalping gains) by not having an exit plan.

guess time to start all over again next week. sigh.

author: sirisaacnuton
body:
That's what I came here to say.  It's pretty easy to say "this shit's coming down" when it's been going up for years.  Of course that's going to happen...at some point.  But until it does, you're missing out on the going up part.

When this article was written, $TSLA was hovering at or just under $200 (800 now).  $NVDA was at $67 (290 now).  $AMZN was at $1000 (2100 now).  $AAPL was at $163 (325 now).  And the author called the thought of owning these stocks in 2017 "absurd."  

The list of companies this guy recommended against owning at that time is so far off from what would go on to happen, it almost reads like an article written now that's intentionally designed to look terrible in retrospect.  Imagine quoting an article that told people to get out of TSLA and AMZN in 2017 and using it as an argument for anything.

author: thirdc0ast
body:
You know the market is a weird place when you make $3k and feel pissed: https://imgur.com/a/1XsV0xx

Sold tesla call gains at open and picked up a couple more, which kept running until I was up about $10k on the day. Broke one of my rules and didn’t take profits to re-roll (It’s so close to 950! 10% day!) and watched them slowly bleed. Had a small recovery near EOD though with tesla and nvda calls. (Praise NVDA)

I made a goal of $30k by end of Feb. a couple weeks ago on here, so I can’t be mad about hitting that on an 11% day though. Still holding tesla and nvda calls (3/6a and 3/20s) too, as well as the usuals like MSFT and AAPL. New goal is $35k by end of Feb.

Thank you for attending my WSB diary. Best of luck out there y’all. 🤙🏻
